episode_title: 812 - The One Where Joey Dates Rachel

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica and Chandler are entering carrying groceries and find Phoebe already there standing in front of a huge object that has been gift wrapped.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! I got you a present!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my goodness! Where did you hide it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I got it for your wedding and I ordered it weeks ago, and it finally got here!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pheebs you didn’t have to get us anything for our wedding you already sang…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I love it! It’s huge!! Let’s open it! Open it!! (Monica rips open the paper.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s a Ms. Pac-Man machine!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I didn’t know where to put it so I just left it here for now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh well, maybe we can put it in the guest bedroom.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right. (He goes to push it and it doesn’t move.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I kinda like it here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Do you really like it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you kidding?! I practically spent my entire childhood at the arcade! This is like—Oh my, this is like my second favorite game!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh really? What was your first?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well I-I really don’t remember the name of it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well what did it do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, you just—you put a quarter in and y’know pull-pull some handles and win like a candy bar or something.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: A vending machine?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t feel bad for me! I won like every time!

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Rachel are there as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Oh, I’m so glad you guys are here. I’ve been dying to tell someone what happened in the Paleontology department today.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do you think he saw us or can we still sneak out?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Professor Neuman, the head of the department, so…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: They made you head of the department!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I get to teach one of his advanced classes! (Pause) Why didn’t I get head of the department? (Goes and gets some coffee.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! Hey Rach, listen umm…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I got a big date coming up, do you know a good restaurant?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, Paul’s Caf�. They got great food and it’s really romantic.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, great! Thanks!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Oh, and then afterwards you can take her to the Four Seasons for drinks. Or you go downtown and listen to some jazz. Or dancing—Oh! Take her dancing!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You sure are naming a lot of ways to postpone sex, I’ll tell ya…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, I miss dating. Gettin’ all dressed up and going to a fancy restaurant. I’m not gonna be able to do that for so long, and it’s so much fun! I mean not that sitting at home worrying about giving birth to a sixteen pound baby is not fun.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, y’know what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why don’t I take you out?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! Joey, you don’t want to go on a date with a pregnant lady.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes I do! And we’re gonna go out, we’re gonna have a good time, and take your mind off of child birth and c-sections and-and giant baby heads stretching out…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! I’ll go with ya! I’ll go! I’ll go with ya.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ll be fun.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right?

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is watching Phoebe play Ms. Pac-Man.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. No! Yes! Ahh. Oh, would you look at that Monica? I just knocked off all of your top scores, how sad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’m next. (Phoebe starts another game.) Don’t! Don’t start another game! I said I’m next! Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. I didn’t hear you over all the winning.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler! Phoebe’s hogging the game!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who cares? It’s a stupid game.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You only think it’s stupid because you suck at it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t suck. It’s sucks. You suck.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait okay, if this game is gonna cause problems between the two of you, then maybe I should just keep it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! No-no! I love it! It is a great present! In fact, why don’t you go home and wait for the thank you card?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why do you want to play this game so bad?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! It’s not like it spits out a Clark bar after every game.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Phoebe that’s it. Come on, get out—out of the chair. Get out! (She goes to move Phoebe, but Phoebe goes limp and Monica can’t move her.) Oh come…Phoebe!

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is getting ready for her date with Joey as there is a knock on the door.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey? Could you get that? (There is no answer and she goes and opens the door to Joey.) What are you doing here? I thought you were in your room?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I’m picking you up for our date. These are for you. (Hands her some flowers.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, Lilies. Joey, they’re my favorite. Thank you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And, a brownie! (Hands her a bag with the brownie in it.) Well, half a brownie. Actually, it’s just bag. It’s been a long walk from the flower shop and I was startin’ to feel faint so…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh man! This is so great! I actually feel like I’m going on a real date! Although, I have a hint of morning sickness, and I’m wearing underwear that goes up to about…(She snaps the waistband on her underwear that is just slightly below her breasts)…there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey come on now, this is a real date. Uh, so…nice place you got here. Foosball, huh? Pizza box. Oh, a subscription to Playboy , my kind of woman.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, actually that’s my roommate’s.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I would like to meet him. He sounds like a stand up guy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah yes, but he’s very protective of me so you’d better watch yourself.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah… Hey, so this roommate of yours…is he good looking?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hm-mmm.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, it must be tough to keep your hands of him, huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, but I’m pretty sure he’s gay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no-no, he’s not! No! Why are you trying to ruin the game? Come on!

content.description: N.Y.U, Ross is teaching a class.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …which brings us back of course to Greely’s theory of dominance. (The bell rings.) Okay, that-that’s all for today. Oh, uh does anyone know where the Freeman building is?

content.speaker: Student
content.text: Yeah, it’s the new building on Avenue A.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! That-that’s all the way cross town, I’m supposed to teach a graduate seminar there in ten minutes.

content.speaker: Student
content.text: Ooh, dude. That’s not gonna happen.
(Ross grabs his things and runs to the door only to be blocked by his exiting students.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Move it! Move it! Move it!! Hey!!! I’m the teacher!!

content.description: The Freeman Building, Ross is entering his new class completely out of breath.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello. (He throws his jacket towards the coat rack and misses.) I’m sorry I’m a little late. Ah—(Checks his watch)—Whoa! A lot late. Let me start by uh, by introducing myself, I am Professor Geller. (The bell rings.) So to sum up, I’m Professor Geller. Good job today.

content.description: A Restaurant, a waitress is taking Joey and Rachel’s dinner order.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now the filet mignon, what comes with that?

content.speaker: Waitress
content.text: There’s a side of steamed vegetables.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Emmm. Now, instead of the vegetables, is there anyway I can substitute the three-pound lobster?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know what? Bring her both, and I’ll have the same. (The waitress leaves.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! This is shaping up to be a pretty good date—Oh, I almost forgot. I didn’t pay you the rent check.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh whoa-whoa-whoa, no roommate stuff. Okay? We’re on a date.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Wow! So I get to see what Joey Tribbiani is like on a date. So do you have any moves?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No. Umm, just myself and if they don’t like me for—(Laughs.) I’m sorry I couldn’t even get through that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I knew it! I knew it. Come on tell me your moves.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh alright. Umm, well, okay, I usually start by having a bottle of wine sent to my table from a fan.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God. And that works?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well it does when you combine it with, “This is so embarrassing, I just want to have a normal life!”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you poor little famous man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh okay, how about this one. I was gonna wait until the end of the night to kiss you, but you’re so beautiful…I don’t think I can.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Wow! That was fantastic, I almost leaned in. I really almost did!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, so…so tell me one of your moves.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright. So where’d you grow up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s your move? Boy Rach, you’re lucky you’re hot.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on, just answer the question!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Queens.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And so were-were you close to your parents?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, with my mom. Yeah, not so much with my dad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. I guess there’s just always been this distance y’know—I mean we both try to pretend it’s not there, but it is.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. (Starts rubbing his wrist with her fingers.) It’s gotta be rough.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, it is. It’s really tough. Y’know sometimes I think—Wow!! Nice move!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: “Where’d you grow up,” it’s so simple!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you! And now if you’ll excuse me, I have to go to the rest room.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.
(Rachel gets up and heads for the rest room.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And now you’re watching me walk away.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes I am! Again so simple!

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is entering to find Chandler playing Ms. Pac-Man.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You are not going to believe what I did today!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well it clearly wasn’t showering or shaving.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I got good. I played this game all day and now I rule at it! They should change the name of it to Ms. Chandler. (Pause) Although I-I hope they don’t.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute, you stayed home all day and played Ms. Pac-Man while I went off to work like some kind of chump?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-huh, and I got all the top ten scores, I erased Phoebe off the board! High five! (Holds up his hand to give Monica a high five, only he can’t straighten his fingers.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is the matter with your hand?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well I’ve been playing it for like eight hours, it’ll loosen up. Come on, check out the scores. Oh, and also look at the initials, they’re dirty words.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, why would you do that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because it’s awesome.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You think this is clever?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well y’know, they only give you three letters, so after A-S-S it is a bit of a challenge.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey wait a minute, this one isn’t dirty.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It is when you put it together with that one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ah, well if you don’t clear this off, you won’t be getting one of those from me. But Ben’s coming over here tomorrow to play this game, this can’t be there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on, he won’t even know what they mean.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler! He’s seven; he’s not stupid.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Have you talked to him lately?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, look I’m just gonna unplug it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no, if you unplug it, I’ll have nothing to show for my day! It would be like I was at work. (She unplugs it.) No! (And plugs it back in.) Hey look at that! Look at that, it’s still there! This thing must have some kind of primitive ROM (Read Only Memory, it’s a memory chip.) Chip in it or something!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey you-you got to beat your scores!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: With the claw?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right fine. Fine, I’ll do it. I’ve just got to get this off the screen. Carol and Susan are still upset that you taught him pull my finger.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pull my finger—(Looks at his hand)—My hand is messed up.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey and Rachel are returning from their date.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I am not gonna answer that!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh come on! Just pick one! Between Monica, Phoebe, Chandler, and Ross if you had to, if you had to, who would you punch?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No one! They are my friends, I wouldn’t punch any of them.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, but I don’t know why. Look at me, I’m having such a wonderful time!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me too! Hey Rach, can I just say I think this is the best date I ever had!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I never laughed so hard—Did you see the wine come out of my nose?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, I think everyone saw the wine come out of your nose.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I gotta say, I never knew I could enjoy the non-sex part of the date so much.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well that is because you have never been on a date with me before.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh. Huh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, now don’t judge me. I normally wait until my date leaves, but you live here. I’m ripping into this swan.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah! Okay, well then you don’t judge me. I’m gonna suck on the cellophane from the brownie I had before. (They both do as they planned.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So tell me, what are Joey Tribbiani’s end of the night moves?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, well, if I want the girl to kiss me, first thing I do is make my lips look irresistible.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How do you do that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Now you can’t tell anyone, but uh…I put on shiny lip balm.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, like a moth to a flame, I’m telling ya. Okay all right, so now you go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I don’t want to tell you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because it’s embarrassing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: More embarrassing than shiny raspberry lip balm?! (Rachel just looks at him.) I didn’t say raspberry before did I? All right just-just tell me Rach, just tell me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. All right, stand up. (They do so.) Well, when we’re at the door, I lightly press my lips against his, and then move into his body just for a second, and then I make this sound, “Hmmm.” Okay, I know it doesn’t sound like anything, but I swear it works.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Why—Yeah, that would work for ya…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, I gotta go to bed. Honey, I had such a wonderful time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. (She kisses him.) Yeah. (She goes into her room.) Me to. (He then starts to freak out.)

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is telling Rachel about his class location predicament.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …you were 50 minutes late to the class, what did you crawl there?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I ran. It was really far, and when did people stop understanding the phrase, “Get the hell out of my way!”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, why didn’t you just take a cab?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ugh, between the traffic that time of day and all the one-way streets it’ll take me twice as long. Besides, I teach the class three times a week, who am I? Rockefeller?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well you’re not gonna be able to keep doing this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I have too. Okay? If I don’t, they’ll take the class away from me. And…I already put it in my family newsletter.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’ve seen it, the Geller Yeller.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right. Wow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Besides, I-I think I figured out a much faster route, I’m sure I can make it this time. I just…I just can’t be afraid to get a little bit…hit by cars. (He goes to the bathroom as Joey enters.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Hey, remember how last night we were talking about that movie Cujo ?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, I still can’t believe you haven’t seen Cujo . What is wrong with you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Relax! It’s not like it’s Citizen Kane !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Have you ever tried to sit through Citizen Kane ?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah I know it’s really boring, but it’s like a big deal. Anyway, I was thinking about renting Cujo sometime.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah? All right, let’s do it tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well don’t you have that big date tonight?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh right!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Joey, can I ask you something?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: After our date last night, did you feel a little weird?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God! You did too? It totally freaked me out, what was that?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know! (Pause) I’m-I’m kinda thinking it-it was the lobster…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah-yeah, the lobster.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I mean I was up sick all night.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah me too, all night.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?! How come we didn’t cross paths?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah well that’s because uh…I stayed in my room. Yeah, you don’t want to look in my hamper.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is trying to erase Chandler’s dirty words while he looks on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I got that. I’ll escape over there. I’ll come back over here. All right, come on Ms. Pac-Man . It’s got—Right—(She dies.) Well, you’re just a little bitch, aren’t you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, you guys. Listen, I’m sorry that I was hogging the game before—(Sees the top ten list)—Oh my God! Your friends have some unfortunate initials!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They’re all Chandler.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler sucks! He couldn’t have gotten this good!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I did. (Looks at his still deformed hand) But it came at a price.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But Ben is coming over tonight and he can’t see this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh come on, by age seven kids have already seen orgies. (They both look at him.) Was it just me?!

content.description: N.Y.U, Ross’s new class, he is entering out of breath.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!!!! Yes, I made it! I’m on time! (Grabs a bottle of water from a student, takes a drink, and splashes some on his face like the marathon runners do.) Okay, why don’t we all uh, (Exhales loudly) open our books to page 23. Where… (Exhales again) Where you will see…a uh…a bunch of uh…red spots. Okay, (Closes his book.) umm, why don’t, why don’t you all start to read, while I—(Passes out and collapses.)

content.description: A Restaurant, Joey is on his hot date and they’re not speaking right now.

content.speaker: Joey’s Date
content.text: Hey. Are you all right? You seem a little distracted.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no! I’m fine. It’s just… Hey, can I ask you something? Have you ever looked at someone that you’ve known for a while and then suddenly…suddenly see them a different way?

content.speaker: Joey’s Date
content.text: You mean like from behind?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, that…that’s exactly it. You’re right. Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey’s Date
content.text: Ew, y’know what? One time I saw this guy from behind and he seemed like a totally normal guy and then he turned around and it was Stephan Baldwin!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh! Yeah. So yeah, so you know exactly what I’m talking about.

content.speaker: Joey’s Date
content.text: Totally! Wow! (Pause) Would you excuse me for a sec?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, sure. (She gets up, walks towards the bathroom, and Joey watches her go.) Ehhh.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, now it’s Phoebe’s turn to erase Chandler from the board.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God Phoebe, you’re on fire!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: One more score to go! You can do it! (Touches her shoulder.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Don’t touch me!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t touch her!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right! Go left! Go left! Go right!! Go right!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t!! I can’t!! (She dies.) Noooooooo!!!!!!! You son of a bitch!!!!!

(At this point a stream of obscenities burst forth from Phoebe’s mouth just in time for Ben and Ross to enter and hear most of it, and in slow motion Ross tries to shield his innocent son from Phoebe’s vulgarity.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh hi Ben—No!! Don’t look at the machine! (Covers the screen.)

content.description: [Scene: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is watching Cujo while Joey returns from his date scaring Rachel.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God! Thank God you’re home! I’m watching Cujo .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alone?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! But what is wrong with this dog?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, did you get to the part where they’re trapped in the car and Cujo’s throwin’ himself at the windshield?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! No! Seriously, what’s wrong with the dog?! Wait a minute, what are you doing home so early? What happened to your date?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh uh, it didn’t work out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Do you want to watch the rest of the movie with me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh uh, okay. Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, I never thought I’d say this about a movie, but I really hope this dog dies. (Joey brings over a stool at sits on it next to Rachel who’s in the big chair.) What are you doing over there? Come sit here, you protect me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh sure, yeah, why not? (Sits on the arm of the chair.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (Pushes play.) Okay, that’s him! That’s him! That’s Cujo! That’s Cujo!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, I know! I know. Yeah, it’ll be okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God…What’s he gonna do now? I can’t watch! (Drags Joey closer to her and cowers into his chest.) Oh. Seriously, how can you watch this? Aren’t you scared?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Terrified. (But for a totally different reason.)

content.description: N.Y.U, Ross’s new class, this time he’s actually about to do a lecture.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So is everybody here? I got here a little early myself. Let us begin. Now, the hydrosaurids have been unearthed in two main locations. (He moves to the map and we see why he made it to class on time, he’s wearing in-line skates and hasn’t taken them off.) Here. (Points to the map, somewhere in the Middle East, then spins on the skates and points to the map.) Here. (China.) Now as for the hydrosaurs…

(He tries to move in front of the class, only goes out of control and rolls into the hall, catching himself on the doorway with his pointer. He then pulls himself back into the room with the pointer, only he jams one end of it between the door frame and the door and breaks the pointer in half.)
